text: :wave: Hello, team!
I want to fetch email marketing, Ads,  Landing Page, Social all analytics using laravel. Can you please share me api link for all this ?

Good Morning
How are you @channel?
How many calls does the HubSpot API have? A second question, is it possible to increase this number of calls?
Do I need to convert the ints to a string?

Hello everyone,
I am going to make devs to synchronize my contacts via the API and I would like to test these.
Therefore, I would need to be able to make API calls on the sandbox. Is it possible ? How do I do this ?
Thanks
Thomas

Hello,
if you have your data in a list in python, you can set ranges with `[from:to]` … so like `myList[0:150]` will give you a slice of this array from index 0 to index 149 -> first 150 elements.
If you do this in a loop and make the range from `[i:i+150]` you can wait after each iteration for 10 seconds, then add `i = i + 150`.

As far as I can tell, it's not possible to do it with a search. You have to get ALL Contacts and then filter that in PHP to get the one you want, and THEN you can get the properties you need.

Why they decided to do it this way is anyones guess.
How do you actually work the Deals API? Like what can you send in to get a search through? I can't seem to get it to return anything
<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals/search/>
Just trying to search by deal ID but apparently can't figure out how to phrase it lol

Hey! We have been trying to understand and implement the Single-send API for Transactional emails. Inside the JSON request that we send, there is an option to add contact & custom properties with the 'name' and 'value' attributes. My question is - can we pass these custom values (sourced from an external database) into their respective merge fields/personalization tokens? Is it necessary to import all the information for Transactional emails into HubSpot first?

P.S. Right now in Mandrill, we are to sending these emails using an API where it dynamically picks up the value of certain merge fields from our own system (backend) inside the JSON request
I can only add `hasUniqueValue` to a property using the API right?
(to a custom object property)

<@U034A8JTTKJ> After long back and forth with HubSpot support their final disappointing but clear answer is:
> I have been doing some additional research and working with an internal team on this and it appears that the Timeline API is *not* one that can be used by *private apps*, and should not have been accessible via the private app. Our internal team is implementing a fix so that this (_ed: the timeline scope_) won’t be able to be added to that scope going forward.
> Currently, Timeline API is not supported by private apps and this is the reason why you have been receiving errors for the timeline API.
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Make-a-custom-property-unique/idi-p/3483>
albeit you are correct that you can make it unique via an api call
(max 2 per custom object)

Hello everyone! Looking through the API docs I can't seem to find a way to fetch a ticket and include more info like the comments inside the ticket. I can find some info about this in the legacy docs but not in the current one. How do you solve this issue?

The best would be to have an endpoint like /company/:id/tickets and it would give me all tickets of the company (not just ticket id:s from /company/:id/associations/tickets). And when getting json from a ticket with id I want the comments aswell. Is this possible?

Hello,

I have a custom form API for the HubSpot But I am not able to pass the UTM data in the form is there anything that I miss

Thanks in Advance
